question: 固有名詞
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>noun</kanji> (<ja>名詞</ja>) that <kanji>has</kanji> <kanji>hard</kanji>ness is a noun that can't be budged. It's a big noun, so big that you have to capitalize these kinds of nouns in English. It is a <vocabulary>proper noun</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well. It will help to know the word <ja>名詞</ja> as well.
